articles.name: Youtuber/Twitch Partner Program
articles.body:
Benefits:

  • Custom Cape, Bandana, Shield and Hat on our shop
  • Premium+ Perks
  • Access to all cosmetics on Silent Client
  • Ability to change Twitch/Youtube Icon
  • Private Discord access with our development/administration teams

Requirements

Youtube:
  • Have a passion for Minecraft content
  • Have an active Youtube channel (at least 3 videos in the last month around MC)
  • Have at least 200 Subscribers
  • Have at least 800-1000 Monthly Views on Channel Overall
Twitch:
  • Have a passion for Minecraft content
  • Have an active Twitch channel (at least 5 streams per month around MC)
  • Have at least 50 followers on Twitch
  • Have at least 10 viewers on average during your streams
  • Have at least 20 hours of MC streamed per month for the past three months.

Application

1) IGN:
2) Youtube Channel (if applicable):
3) Twitch Channel (if applicable):
4) Most recent youtube video:

How to Apply

Anyone who is a content creator that meets our requirements listed out can contact creators@silentclient.net.
articles.author: kirillsaint

articles.name: Adding mods to Silent Client or Using it with Forge
articles.body:
Can I add my own mods to Silent Client?

No, you can't do it. Silent Client is a Minecraft client that includes a variety of custom-coded mods, FPS boosting features, custom cosmetics, and many more unique features. All mods and features need to be coded by hand by our developers (except a few which the original developer gave approval to us), which means that you won't be able to add mods on your own.

This also means that you cannot use Silent Client with Forge as the mods were coded for Silent Client and not Forge.
articles.author: kirillsaint

articles.name: Silent Client FAQ
articles.body:
Frequently Asked Questions

In this help article, you will find answers to the most asked questions. If you can't find your answer, please contact our customer support agents by creating a new support ticket: click here.

What is Silent Client?

Silent Client is a Minecraft client with built-in FPS boost, mods and more.
We are actively working to improve the client and add innovations that our players have asked us for.

Does the Silent Client contain any viruses or trojans?

The Silent Client contains no malicious software such as viruses or trojans. We use special software to protect our intellectual property in the launcher. Sometimes, this is flagged by antivirus services as a virus or a trojan due to how the protection software manipulates the machine language code. Please ignore these warnings and add an exception to your antivirus software for the Silent Client if this happens to you.

Where can I report game bugs?

If you have found a game bug and want to report it to get it fixed as soon as possible, please follow the instructions in this help article: click here.

What mods does the Silent Client use?

The Silent Client supports many mods; too many to list here. The Silent Client team is constantly updating them alongside adding new mods. You can find all mods in the game by pressing the RIGHT-SHIFT key.

Can I add my own mods?

No, You cannot add your own mods to the Silent Client. We have explained it in the support article dedicated to this topic: click here.

Where can I find information about the latest Silent Client updates?

You can find them in the following places:
- News (click here)
- Discord (click here)
- Telegram (click here)
- VK (click here)
articles.author: kirillsaint

articles.name: Client Mod Application
articles.body:
Description of the position: The Client Moderator position is the front page of the client. It’s a combination of in-game moderation, Discord moderation, and user support. We currently have 2 platforms for support; our Discord and Support Platform.

It is important that all aspects of our client are kept up-to-date, clean of toxicity and resourceful at all times. By joining our team, you will receive help from experienced staff members to develop an understanding of the problems most users face and how to resolve them.

We want you to

  • Be curious, wanting to learn and improve yourself
  • Have a creative and open mind
  • Be able to work in a team to achieve bigger goals
  • Have the determination to make our client the best client possible
  • Excellent communication skills, able to form positive relationships with the rest of the team
  • Have the capability to receive criticism and listening to others feedback to better yourself, in a non-reactionary way
  • Ability to provide calm, mature and clear instructions to our playerbase 


Bonus

  • Deep understanding of the features of the Silent Client
  • Knowledge of Windows and troubleshooting
  • Be able to speak fluently in different languages
  • Previous experience helping game players of all ages and backgrounds


Extra Notice

  • Personal information: Please do not give out your personal information (ex : full real name, email) in your application. If we are in need of any more information other than what was asked in the application, we will ask you for it.
  • Application Responses: If you have not received any response to your application within 30 days of it being sent, this means you’ve gotten denied. Please note that only the successful applicants will receive a response to their application.
  • If accepted: If your application was accepted, one of our Client Manager will add you on discord and contact you there. Further information will be disclosed there about joining the client moderation team.

    Do not contact any staff members regarding your staff application as it will result in an instant denial. You can only apply for this position once every two months.


Application format

  • Basic Information
  • Minecraft Username - 
  • Previous Username (link your namemc if there’s multiple) -
  • Discord Username (ex : kirillsaint#1330) -
  • Country and Timezone -
  • Age (Note : you must be over 13 to apply) -
  • Gaming Twitter Link (If you have one) -
  • Fluent Languages Spoken -
  • Current rank (Premium or normal rank) -


Staffing Experience

  • Do you have any past experience as a staff member on a public server? (Minecraft, Discord, or other games)
  • Why have you decided to apply for the Client Moderator position?
  • Using your past experiences (as staff or in real life), what skills have you learnt or developed that can benefit the client?
  • Were you previously demoted or fired and if so, what was the reason and what would you do differently?
  • Which Minecraft Server are you the most active on?
  • What would you consider your greatest strength, and your biggest weakness?


Other information

  • How much time could you contribute to the position?
  • Have you previously applied for Client Moderator, and if so, when was your last application?
  • Is there anything else we should know or that you would like to add?


How to Apply?

Apply now by emailing the filled in format to clientmod@silentclient.net with the subject: "Silent Client Mod Team Application” and you could be the next person to join the Client Moderation team!
articles.author: kirillsaint

articles.name: Tester Application
articles.body:
What is a Tester?

The role of a Tester in the team is to find bugs, or issues within the client and report them to the developers. You may find yourself reporting game crashes, mods that do not work as intended or helping other testers check problems within the client.

A typical day for a tester involves the following:

  • Checking the Discord for announcements and/or new features to test
  • Communicating with other testers/developers to fix bugs
  • Reporting bugs
  • Attempting to break the game
  • Playing the game


Requirements

  • At least 14 years old
  • A team-orientated mindset
  • At least a few hours a week can be put toward testing
  • Good communication
  • In-depth knowledge of the Silent Client
  • Detailed application
  • BONUS: High level in (a) specific game mode(s) (e.g. Bedwars, Skywars)


How to apply

To apply, please simply fill out this form.

Please do not share your personal information (e.g. full real name, address) in your application. If we require any more information other than what was asked in the application, we will make sure to contact you regarding it. If you have not received any response to your application within 30 days of it being sent, it means that you got denied. Please note that only the successful applicants will receive a response to their application.

Do not contact any staff members regarding your application, as it will result in an instant denial.
articles.author: kirillsaint

categories.name: Account Management
categories.description: Registering and Managing the Silent Client Account.

articles.name: Registering for Silent Client
articles.body:
Step one:
To register in Silent Client, you need to go to the registration page. Click here to open the registration page.

Step two:
Fill out the registration form and click "Register".
Attention! In the Minecraft Username field, you need to specify the username that will be used in the game.

Step three:
Congratulations, and welcome to Silent Client! You have successfully registered on Silent Client!
articles.author: kirillsaint

articles.name: Changing your email, password and privacy settings
articles.body:
To change any of your account information, go to the profile edit page: https://store.silentclient.net/edit_account.
We tried to simplify the interface as much as possible so that even a child could figure it out.
articles.author: kirillsaint

articles.name: Reseting your Password
articles.body:
Step one:
Open your web browser and go to https://store.silentclient.net/reset_password

Step two:
Enter your Email address linked to your Silent Client account. If you no longer have access to Email, you need to create a new account. Click here to open the guide.

Step three:
After filling in the email address, click the "Reset" button.

Step four:
Go to your inbox and look for a message from Silent Client. If you don't see messages in your main inbox, check your spam/junk folders.

Step five:
The email will contain the generated password, use it to log into your account.
articles.author: kirillsaint

categories.name: Support Center
categories.description: Payment Support, Technical Support, and Vanilla Minecraft Problems.

articles.name: Adding More Memory (RAM) to your Silent Client
articles.body:
When should I change the amount of allocated memory?

We all love to play Minecraft, especially when using high-resolution resource packs and shaders, but using such resources in Minecraft makes it power-hungry. It consumes a lot of memory (RAM) on your computer. If your game does not have enough memory allocated to it, its frames (FPS) may decrease, and you might start experiencing lag spikes (FPS drops), it may load slowly, and sometimes it might even crash. If you start experiencing any of the mentioned problems, you should consider using the built-in option to change the amount of allocated memory.

How can I add more memory to Minecraft on the Silent Client launcher?

Note: we do not suggest allocating more than half of the available memory. You should keep the allocated memory between 2-4 GB, depending on how much total RAM your computer has.

If you want to change the amount of allocated memory, you need to do the following:
  • Open the Silent Client launcher and click the "Settings" button, as shown in the screenshot below.
  • Find "Allocate RAM (MB)" slider. You can click anywhere on the slider to change the amount of the allocated memory.
articles.author: kirillsaint

articles.name: Game has no sound
articles.body:
Check the in-game sound settings to make sure you haven't muted any sounds.
If you don't know where to find Minecraft sound & music settings, do the following: open Minecraft Options, then click on the "Music & Sounds" button.

Check your computer's volume mixer or any other sound software that you have installed to make sure you haven't muted the Silent Client.
Open the Silent Client launcher, then launch the game, and only then open the volume mixer.

Try reloading resources.
To do that, you need to connect to a server or singleplayer world, then press the ESC key on your keyboard, and then click on the "Reload Resources" button at the bottom left corner.

If the same issue persists, please submit a bug report through the launcher immediately after having this issue.
articles.author: kirillsaint

articles.name: Submitting a Bug Report
articles.body:
How can I submit a bug report?

If you have found a bug, please do the following to report it to us:
  • Click on "Submit Bug Report" at the bottom of the launcher. If you have changed the language in the launcher, it will say something else.
  • It will bring you to this page where you have to fill out some questions so we can know what is wrong.
    Make sure to explain the issue in detail and provide a screenshot or video if possible. A well-written bug report helps our Tech Support team and developers to reproduce and fix the bug. You can use https://workupload.com/ to upload screenshots and videos.
    Please do not remove any logs from your bug report! Our Tech Support and developers need your logs to see the exact cause of the issue! If your bug report is missing logs, restart the launcher, reproduce the problem, and submit a new bug report through the bottom of the launcher, as explained in this article above.
  • Don't forget to click "Submit" when you have finished!
Once you have submitted a bug report, our Tech Support team should review and respond to it within a few hours.
articles.author: kirillsaint

articles.name: Updating Windows and Graphics Driver
articles.body:
Updating Graphics Card via the internet

Your Windows installation and your graphics drivers are probably requiring an update to be able to run the SIlent Client smoothly.

If you know what graphics card you have, feel free to update it on your own; else, go to "Updating Graphics card via Windows" in this article.

  • AMD - https://www.amd.com/en/support
  • Nvidia - https://www.nvidia.com/Download/index.aspx
  • Intel - https://downloadcenter.intel.com/product/80939/Graphics

Updating through Device Manager

If you wish to update your graphics card through your computer, you will need to do so through Device Manager. Do this after downloading the correct driver from the links above.

1) Type "Device Manager" in Start Menu.

2) Go to "Display Adapters" and whichever driver shows up there.

  • You will need to right click and select "Update".

3) Click "Search Automatically for Drivers".

4) Done!

Updating Graphics card via Windows

Users who understand the computer and its working should do this, or else use the basic guide.

Manually Install Driver Updates

  1. Type "Check for Updates" in Start Menu.


  2. The window should look like the following image.


  3. Click on "View Optional Updates".


  4. The following window will pop up.


  5. Select everything that is from NVIDIA/Intel/AMD/Ryzen and click "Download and Install".


  6. You will then be brought back to the "Windows Update" page and it will show you the process of the updates.


  7. Once it is done this notification will pop up; and then restart your computer.
articles.author: kirillsaint

articles.name: Multiplayer Connection Issues
articles.body:
We have created this article to help any Minecraft Client user resolve multiplayer connection issues. In this help article, you will find information about the following connection errors:

  • Internal Exception: java.net.SocketException: Connection Reset
  • Failed to log in: null
  • Failed to login: The authentication servers are currently down for maintenance
  • Invalid session. Try restarting Minecraft

You can click on the links above to go to a specific point in this article.
Disclaimer: Silent Client assumes no responsibility for any errors that might occur while doing things not listed in this article or messing something up. Do everything at your own risk!

Fixing "Internal Exception: java.net.SocketException: Connection Reset"

If the game shows this error when trying to connect to Minecraft servers, something on your side is blocking or interfering with the game connections. Do the following to fix the problem:

1. Temporarily disable all VPNs, Hamachi, Antiviruses, and firewalls (especially third-party firewalls).
They are known for blocking game connections. We do not know what third-party firewalls you have installed; you need to use an online search engine such as Google to find instructions on how to disable them. Make sure to uninstall incompatible software as well; click here to find a list of them.

2. Whitelist the game's JREs (Java Runtime Environment) on your operating system's firewall settings.
If Windows Firewall has blocked Minecraft's Internet access, the connection failure will occur. You can temporarily disable the firewall as mentioned above or whitelist the game to see if that's the case. If you do not know how to whitelist a game on your firewall settings on Windows, do the following:

If you are using Silent Client:
  1. Press the Windows Key and type "firewall."
  2. Click on "Allow an app through Windows Firewall."
  3. Click on "Allow another app..."
  4. Click Browse, then navigate to:
    %appdata%\.minecraft\.silentclient\bin\javaw.exe
  5. Click Open, then Add.
  6. Click OK and open Silent Client again.

If you are using Vanilla Minecraft:
  1. Press the Windows Key and type "firewall."
  2. Click on "Allow an app through Windows Firewall."
  3. Click on "Allow another app..."
  4. Click Browse, then navigate to:
    C:\Program Files (x86)\Minecraft\runtime\java-runtime-alpha\windows-x64\java-runtime-alpha\bin\javaw.exe
  5. Click Open, then Add.
  6. Click OK and open Minecraft again.

3. Try on another connection, such as mobile data via wireless hotspot or USB tethering.
If this option fixes the problem, your network connection might have some problems. In that case, we suggest running a network troubleshooter.

4. Try refreshing your network settings.
If you do not know how to do it, follow the instructions below:
  1. Press the Windows Key, then type cmd.
  2. Under 'Command Prompt,' click Run as administrator
  3. Type netsh winsock reset and press Enter.
  4. Type netsh int ip reset and press Enter.
  5. Type ipconfig /release and press Enter.
  6. Type ipconfig /renew and press Enter.
  7. Type ipconfig /flushdns and press Enter.

Additionally, do the following:
  1. Press the Windows Key, then type cmd.
  2. Under 'Command Prompt,' click Run as administrator
  3. Type netsh interface tcp show global and press Enter.
  4. If Receive-Side Scaling State is disabled, type netsh interface tcp set global rss=enabled and press enter.
  5. If "Receive Window Auto-Tuning Level" is disabled, type netsh interface tcp set global autotuninglevel=normal and press enter.


Fixing "Failed to log in: null."

The error is often caused by Microsoft accounts being under the minimum age requirement or by misconfigured Microsoft/Xbox privacy settings.

1. Open your Microsoft/Xbox account Privacy Settings and change them to allow you to play on Multiplayer.
If you do not know how to do it, follow the instructions below:
  1. Log in to https://account.xbox.com/settings  with your Microsoft account.
  2. In the navigation tabs, click Xbox Series X|S, Xbox One, and Windows 10 devices Online Safety
  3. Select Allow for You can create and join clubs, and You can join multiplayer games.

2. Add your Microsoft account to a Family plan.
You need to go to https://account.microsoft.com/family/ and follow the instructions given there.

Fixing "Failed to login: The authentication servers are currently down for maintenance."

1. Remove illegal non-premium account tools.
This connection issue is likely caused by using illegal or incompatible software, which is known to corrupt your hosts list by redirecting any Mojang authentification server address to their own illicit servers. To fix this, you need to remove non-official software; then, you must fix your affected hosts file.

If you have used third-party authenticators like "MCLeaks", "TheAltening", "EasyMC", or anything similar on your computer, you need to switch back to the Mojang/Microsoft authenticator through the third-party authenticator you used and then uninstall it from the computer.

Once you have done that, you need to restore your system's hosts file. If you do not know how to do it, click the links below.

Windows: click here.
Linux: click here.
macOS: click here.

2. Check Minecraft servers' status.
If Minecraft servers are down, the game will show the same error message. The best website to check if Minecraft servers are down/having problems is https://downdetector.com/status/minecraft/

If you see a big spike, it means Minecraft servers are down. In that case, the only option is to wait for Mojang or Microsoft to fix the problem.

Fixing "Invalid session. Try restarting Minecraft."

This error can easily be fixed by logging out of the game and back in to refresh your session ID. If you do not know how to re-log on your account, do the following:

If you are using Silent Client:
  1. Open the Silent Client launcher but do NOT launch the game.
  2. Click the Minecraft account selector above the LAUNCH button.
  3. Click the "Logout" button for your Minecraft account(s).
  4. Open the Minecraft account selector again.
  5. Click the "Add Account" button and write your Java Edition Minecraft account login information.
  6. Once you have re-added your Minecraft account in the launcher, launch the game.
  7. Connect to a server.

If you are using Vanilla Minecraft:
  1. Open the Minecraft launcher.
  2. Click on your account name and icon at the top left corner of the launcher.
  3. Click on "Log Out."
  4. Click the login button and write your Minecraft login information.
  5. Once you have done that, launch the game.
articles.author: kirillsaint

categories.name: Premium Rank Help
categories.description: Silent Premium and Its Features and Custom Capes.

articles.name: Premium and Premium+ Ranks
articles.body:
The Premium and Premium+ ranks give you access to exclusive features to enhance your Minecraft gaming experience. It is also a great way to support our work and pursue the development of the Silent Client. You can purchase Premium and Premium+ in our store: https://store.silentclient.net/premium

Enabling Beta Mode & Having Early Access to New Features

Both the Premium and the Premium+ rank allow you to have early access to the new features of the Silent Client. You can play on the Beta version by ticking the "Beta" option above the launch button.



Opening Premium settings

To open Premium settings, connect to a single-player world or server, press RSHIFT on your keyboard and go to the Premium tab.





Premium features

You can find a full list of the Premium and Premium+ features on our store. Here is the link to it: https://store.silentclient.net/premium

Premium Nametag Icon



Premium+ Nametag Icon



The Premium and Premium+ icons can be seen by anyone who uses the Silent Client. The icon shows before your name, on the tab list, and the friends' list.
Note: You must enable the Nametags mod to see nametag icons and messages.

Premium+ Nametag Message



The Premium+ custom message lets you add a custom message above your name!
You can add your nametag message by clicking on the text field at the bottom of Premium settings, writing a message, and clicking on the "Save" button.

Premium+ Custom Capes


Create your own custom cape with the Premium+ feature. Your cape will be seen by every player who uses the Silent Client.
You can find more information about HD skins in this help article: https://support.silentclient.net/article/custom-capes
articles.author: kirillsaint

articles.name: Custom Capes
articles.body:
Custom Capes

The Custom Capes feature allows Premium+ Users to upload their cape onto Silent Client and then use them once approved.

Finding the Custom Capes menu

To open the Custom Capes menu: Click Here


Uploading and using Custom Capes

To download a Custom Cape, click the "Create Custom Cape" button and fill in all the fields.Attention! We are using our own template for cape textures, click the "Tutorial" button to read more. Afterward, you'll have to wait for a staff member to approve or deny your cape.

If your Custom Cape is denied, a message saying "Rejected" will show up on the cape board, preventing you from using it.

If your custom cape is approved, you will be able to select it from the cosmetics menu.
articles.author: kirillsaint

articles.name: Silent Client Settings - General
articles.author: Silent_Client
articles.body:
The Silent Client settings offer you the possibility to adjust the game to your preferences and enhance your gameplay experience to its finest.

How do I open the Settings?
  • Press ESC and click on “Silent Options”. You can also press “Right-Shift” and press “Settings” in the top left corner of the menu.
  • Select the “General” category.



What do the settings do?
Gui Debug: when enabled, it adds the following information to the GUI Editor:


Hide Mods in F3: if enabled, mods are not shown when F3 is enabled.

Vanilla ESC Menu Layout: if enabled, the esc menu uses the vanilla button style instead of ours.

Menu Background Blur: when enabled, Silent Client menus will have a blurred-out background when opened.
With Menu Blur:

Without Menu Blur:


Silent Logo Location: when a inventory is opened, select where you want the Silent logo to be positioned.

Silent Button Sounds: if enabled, pressing the buttons in the Silent Client menu will play a sound.

Menu Animations: if enabled, there will be an animation when opening the menu.

Menu Animations: allows you to adjust the speed of the animation. (This requires Menu Animations to be enabled.)

articles.name: Silent Client Settings - Render
articles.author: Silent_Client
articles.body:
The Silent Client settings offer you the possibility to adjust the game to your preferences and enhance your gameplay experience to its finest.

How do I open the Settings?
  • Press ESC and click on “Silent Options”. You can also press “Right-Shift” and press “Settings” in the top left corner of the menu.
  • Select the “Render” category.



What do the settings do?
Crosshair in F5: keeps your crosshair even after changing to a different perspective

Centered Potion Inventory: keeps your inventory centered when having potion effects

Disable Achievements: disables achievements notifications

Model Bobbing Only: disables world bobbing if view bobbing is enabled.

articles.name: Silent Client Settings - FPS Boost
articles.author: Silent_Client
articles.body:
The Silent Client settings offer you the possibility to adjust the game to your preferences and enhance your gameplay experience to its finest.

How do I open the Settings?
  • Press ESC and click on “Silent Options”. You can also press “Right-Shift” and press “Settings” in the top left corner of the menu.
  • Select the “FPS Boost” category.



What settings should I enable?
This is based on your personal preference. Generally speaking, the more you enable, the more FPS you will get. These are the settings which we offer:
  • You can decrease the Render Distance of Players, as well as various different Entities. (Passive, Hostile & Miscellaneous)
  • However, you can also disable various different blocks and entities from being rendered. These are the to choose from:
  • We also offer an “FPS Boost” feature. This feature does not negatively impact your gameplay experience and still optimizes your performance!
  • We also offer the Lazy Chunk Loading, as well as Occlusion Culling options.
  • You can also enable both Advanced FPS Boost and Entity Movement Optimization settings, as well as a Hud Optimization and a Low Graphics Mode.

articles.name: Cosmetics Menu
articles.author: kirillsaint
articles.body:
About Cosmetics

Cosmetics are a visual add-on to your Minecraft character for Silent Client. Cosmetics can only be seen by users who use Silent Client.

These cosmetics come in 6 types:
  1. Capes
  2. Wings
  3. Bandanas
  4. Hats
  5. Shields
  6. Nametag Icons

Prices of cosmetics can vary from $0.5 USD (nametag icons) all the way to $3 USD (wings).
Custom capes can be created by Premium+ subscribers and content creators!

Finding the cosmetics menu

You need to launch the game through the Silent Client launcher, then connect to a single-player world or server, press ESC and click the "Cosmetics" button.


Purchasing cosmetics

You can either visit the Silent Client Store through the cosmetics menu to preview and purchase cosmetics.

articles.name: Turning Cosmetics On/Off
articles.author: kirillsaint
articles.body:
If you have purchased Silent Client cosmetics but don't know how to access them, do the following:
  • Open the Silent Client launcher and launch Minecraft.
  • Connect to a single-player world or server, press ESC and click the "Cosmetics" button.
  • It will bring you to this menu where you can turn on or off any cosmetics that you have purchased.

You can now shine with your cosmetics on the Silent Client! Thank you for supporting our work!

categories.name: Mods and Features
categories.description: Simple and Complex Mods and Other Features.
